occurrences.text: and in your life, there are some things that we hold grips on a little tighter than other things. Is it not true? Sometimes we struggle with the idea of surrender. Why? Because I want it. I want to do what I want to do. I want to have my control in my life. We find that they first gave their own selves to the Lord and unto us by the will of God. What's the result of living a surrendered life? Well, it's obedience and submission to the Lord, but what does it lead to? What does it look like? What happens? What is the result when we live a life that is surrendered to the Lord? Well, I believe, first of all, the Lord is magnified. The Lord is magnified. Listen, in our lives, in your life and in my life, we ought to desire nothing more, nothing less, but then for Jesus Christ alone to be magnified, to be exalted. You know how that's achieved? You know how that's accomplished? By living a life of surrender, by living a life of surrender. Because through living that life of surrender, which results in obedience and submission to the Lord, it leads to a place of God being magnified. Let God be magnified. You read that in Psalm 70. Let God be magnified. You read that John the Baptist, he said, he must increase, I must decrease.

And the idea this morning that we desire that through our lives that the Lord Jesus Christ would be magnified. I said this by way of introduction that when we struggle with the idea, when our response of resisting the idea of surrender, that it leads to great struggle in the life of a believer and it hinders our effectiveness for the Lord. You want God to be magnified? I hope your answer would be yes. Live a life of surrender. Lord, take my life and let it be. Lord, you died for me. You loved me. You gave me life. I just want to live for you. We find that it will lead to the Lord being magnified. I believe this morning that it will lead to brethren being edified. We see it here in 2 Corinthians chapter number 8. How that through this gift that they would give, how that others would benefit and be encouraged and be edified.
